full_summary:
================================

### Investigation Services Request for Supply Arrangement

*Reference Number: cb-6739-57740382*

*Amendment Number: 6*

#### Overview

The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) invites interested suppliers to become qualified to provide investigative services as part of a Request for Supply Arrangement (RFSA).

*Publication Date: 2023-07-01*

*Tender Closing Date: 2025-10-27T17:00:00*

The Supply Arrangement is an ongoing opportunity to qualify suppliers. Suppliers may submit a bid at any time to become eligible for supply arrangement issuance throughout the entire refresh period of the bidding process.

### Request Requirements

The CSC requires investigative services for cases of alleged employee misconduct. Contractors must provide these services on an as-needed basis and within short timeframes. Deliverables include, but are not limited to:

* Progress reports
* Incident descriptions
* Statements from individuals with knowledge of the incident
* Regulatory framework documentation
* Interview notes
* Audio/video recordings
* Physical evidence
* Draft and final Disciplinary Investigation Reports

### Evaluation Criteria

Evaluation criteria include, but are not limited to:

* Suppliers' ability to provide effective investigative services
* Timeliness and efficiency of services
* Adherence to regulatory requirements
* Quality of deliverables

### Contracting Entity

*Contracting Entity: Correctional Service Canada*
*Contracting Officer: Jason St-Onge (jason.st-onge@csc-scc.gc.ca, 506 269 3765)*

### Documents

Interested suppliers can obtain the complete Statement of Work and Evaluation Criteria by downloading the solicitation document and associated documents from Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders.

### Contact

For more information, please contact:
Jason St-Onge, Procurement Officer
Phone: (506) 269-3765
Email: [jason.st-onge@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:jason.st-onge@csc-scc.gc.ca)

### Additional Information

*The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.*
*Documents may be submitted in either English or French.*
*Given the nature of the requirements, proposals submitted by fax or email will not be accepted.*
